current_events.description: U.S. President Donald Trump announces a universal 10% tariff on most imports, 20% on EU goods, and 34% on Chinese goods.
China increases tariffs on U.S. goods to 84%.
Trump raises tariffs on Chinese goods to 125%.
Amazon suspends orders on some Chinese/Asian goods amid trade war fears.
Canada announces a 25% tariff on certain U.S. vehicle imports.
EU announces retaliatory duties
Russian artillery/glide bombs hit Kherson, Ukraine, killing one, injuring nine.
Large-scale drone attack on Dnipro, Ukraine, kills two, injures 16.
Al-Shabaab militants capture Adan Yabal District, Somalia.
California sues the Trump administration over tariffs.
Boat collision on Lewis Smith Lake, Alabama, kills three during a fishing tournament.
UK suspends EU cheese/meat imports due to foot-and-mouth disease concerns.
Slovak government passes controversial NGO funding disclosure law.
James Webb Space Telescope detects dimethyl sulfide
Russian forces target Kharkiv with Geran-2 drones.
Russian missile strike hits industrial park in Kryvyi Rih, Ukraine.
Israeli Air Force launches airstrikes in Syria targeting military infrastructure.
U.S. President Trump announces universal 10% tariff on most imports, 20% on EU goods, and 34% on Chinese goods
current_events.source: This seems like a duplicate or clarification from April 21st entry, keeping for now

current_events.description: A Gaza-bound activist aid ship
_Rust_ movie released theatrically in the US, years after the fatal on-set shooting.
Trump administration terminates _de minimis_ tariff exemption; Shein/Temu adjust prices/shipping.
Israeli Security Cabinet confirms plans for indefinite occupation of Gaza.
Mass shooting and shootout in Makhachkala, Dagestan, Russia.
The Vatican announces plans to convert the Popemobile into a mobile health clinic for wounded children in Gaza.

NFL.headline: Washington D.C. named host city for the 2027 NFL Draft.
Former Patriots WR Julian Edelman voted into the team's Hall of Fame by fans.
Cleveland Browns LB Devin Bush arrested and charged with assault.
Buffalo Bills reportedly adding free agent WR Elijah Moore.
Green Bay Packers picked up the 5th-year option for DL Devonte Wyatt, declined option for LB Quay Walker.
The 2025 NFL Draft took place from April 25-27, with QB Cam Ward selected first overall by the Indianapolis Colts.
Former agent and business partner of John Elway, Gary Zimmerman, died after a fall.

NBA.headline: The second round of the 2025 NBA Playoffs is underway. Key matchups include Celtics vs. Knicks and Thunder vs. Nuggets.
Utah Jazz and Head Coach Will Hardy agreed to a contract extension.
Tyrese Haliburton led the Indiana Pacers to a Game 1 victory over the Cleveland Cavaliers in the Eastern Conference Semifinals.
The Golden State Warriors defeated the Houston Rockets in Game 7 of their first-round series.
The Denver Nuggets defeated the Los Angeles Clippers in Game 7 of their first-round series, setting up a matchup with the Oklahoma City Thunder.
Gregg Popovich announced his retirement as head coach of the San Antonio Spurs; Mitch Johnson named successor.

MLB.headline: Arizona Diamondbacks unveiled new City Connect uniforms.
Kansas City Royals set a club record by hitting seven home runs in a game against the Baltimore Orioles. Maikel Garcia hit two.
Boston Red Sox 1B Triston Casas confirmed out for the season after knee surgery.
Shohei Ohtani and Freddie Freeman homered as the Los Angeles Dodgers defeated the Atlanta Braves. Roki Sasaki earned his first MLB win.
Chicago Cubs rookie Pete Crow-Armstrong homered for the third time in two games.
Los Angeles Angels star Mike Trout placed on the Injured List with a bone bruise.
Cincinnati Reds pitcher Hunter Greene struck out 12 batters against the Washington Nationals.
San Diego Padres star Fernando Tatis Jr. left a game after being hit by a pitch; X-rays were negative.
